column4: were can I find a list of programs that will work on ubuntu that I currently use in windows?
starting up ubuntu for the first time today so I wana prepare myself
I geuss the best way to get allong is to run both xp and ubuntu to learn?
I used gimp made me wana puke
but still I had enough of xp

if you can use Gimp instead of photoshop it is easier for you. But it is possible to run the Adobe apps inside of Linux, see here: http://blog.publicidadpixelada.com/how-to-adobe-photoshop-cs2-on-ubuntu-10-steps/
I have used both Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign on linux.
you have to decide if you want to keep XP or just want to have Ubuntu but generally yes
if you keep XP as well you can still access your files and stuff from inside Ubuntu if that is what you mean
yes it will, but it needs a separate partition. but the installer can take care of that for you.
it's not but it is great if you just want to try ubuntu without changing your setup :)
depends on the type of raid but most likely yes!
what kind of raid do you have?
